result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas W Zagorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-08-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.

with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Consecutive to: any sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolas W Zagorski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney provided proof of restitution paid to Signicast LLC for $5,850.00.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for Mark A. Pecora.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Theft from Business Setting (as party to a crime), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(b), a class A misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve ONE (1) DAY in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for ONE (1) day served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 12-08-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
(from) Probation/Parole Agent Regina Ferrell to the Court.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

NO FILE IN COURT.

Defendant is testing negative, has begun community service.

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report from the State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections received and filed.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri on behalf of attorney Mark Pecora.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant made all contacts, is employed and provided verification, and all tests have been negative. Defendant is to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21.
Filed,  signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement(DPA).  The Court reviewed the DPA with the defendant.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.
The parties stipulate to the criminal complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of NINE (9) months.
The Court approved the DPA and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to 4-28-2015 at 1:30pm Branch 6 for review.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Original Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Signicast located at 9000 N. 55th Street, in the Village of Brown Deer, Milwaukee County, WI.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Nickolas W Zagorski in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/22/15 @ 1:30pm
